content.title: Maternity Assistance Scheme (GBOCWWB)
content.department: Labour, Skill Development & Employment Department, Government of Gujarat
content.beneficiary: Women construction workers and construction workers' wives
content.details: The 'Maternity Assistance Scheme' is implemented by the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board (GBOCWWB). The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance during pregnancy to women construction workers and construction workers' wives registered with the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board and to provide social stability to construction workers.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹6,000/- is provided to the wife of a registered construction worker for the first two deliveries.
Financial assistance of ₹37,500/- is provided to a registered female construction worker for the first two deliveries.
Benefits are also provided in case of miscarriage.
The application period is up to six months from the date of conception.
eligibility: Construction workers registered with the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board.
The construction worker should have an active membership of the Board.
Financial assistance is provided for the first two births of both a registered female construction worker and the wife of a registered construction worker.
documents_required: Proof of age (Birth certificate/Driving Licence/PAN Card/Voter ID Card)
Surgeon/Gynaecologist/Gynaecology PHC approved doctor's certificate/copy of Mamta card (in case of registered female worker)
Copy of the first page of the bank passbook

faqs.question: Who administers the Maternity Assistance Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is administered by the Labour, Skill Development & Employment Department, Government of Gujarat, through the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the Scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance during pregnancy to women construction workers and construction workers' wives registered with the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board and to provide social stability to construction workers.

faqs.question: What benefits does the scheme offer?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, the wife of a registered construction worker receives ₹6,000/- for the first two deliveries, while a registered female construction worker is entitled to ₹37,500/- for the first two deliveries.

faqs.question: How is the financial assistance disbursed?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance is disbursed directly through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the beneficiary's account.

faqs.question: Does the scheme provide benefits in case of miscarriage?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme also provides benefits in case of miscarriage.

faqs.question: What is the application period for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The application period extends up to six months from the date of conception.

faqs.question: What are the rules and conditions for availing maternity assistance?
faqs.answer: Before maternity assistance, registered female construction workers should apply within six months, along with a certified doctor's certificate.

faqs.question: What additional financial assistance is provided post-delivery?
faqs.answer: In the case of post-delivery application, registered female construction workers receive ₹20,000/-, and the wife of a construction worker receives ₹6,000/-.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: Construction workers registered with the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board, with active membership, are eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is there a deadline for applying for maternity assistance after delivery?
faqs.answer: Yes, the application should be made within 12 months after delivery.

faqs.question: Are there any restrictions on the number of times a beneficiary can claim assistance?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides assistance for the first two deliveries per registered female construction worker and the wife of a registered construction worker.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant may visit the Sanman Portal.

faqs.question: Can an applicant also apply through offline mode?
faqs.answer: Yes, for availing of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant may visit the district office of the BOCW Board.
